title: What's the difference between a G♭ and an F#? - Quora

response.answer_text: In terms of the note, there’s no difference. The difference is only notational, depending on the scale you’re performing in. For example, in the key of E-flat minor, the note would be called a G-flat, since a minor chord has the third tone a half-step down from its major counterpart. But in the key of D major, it would be called an F-sharp, because that’s the note two whole steps up from the root.
